title: Find out if you can check someone's criminal record

body.content:
Use this tool to find out if you can apply for a DBS check (formerly a CRB check). You can only check someone's criminal record if they're applying for certain roles. 

^This tool only covers roles in England and Wales. Find out if you can get a check in [Scotland](https://www.disclosurescotland.co.uk/disclosureinformation/index.htm) or [Northern Ireland.](http://www.nidirect.gov.uk/accessni-checks)^

##If you're applying for the role
You can’t get a check for yourself, but you can use this tool to see if your criminal record can be checked.

If your employer can’t check your record they may ask you to [request a 'basic disclosure'](http://www.disclosurescotland.co.uk/basicdisclosureonline/index.htm) instead.

##Checking for a management role

Use this tool to see if you can check the staff they manage. If you can, you can request that same check for the manager.



*[DBS]: Disclosure and Barring Service
*[CRB]: Criminal Record Bureau

Use this tool to find out if you can apply for a DBS check (formerly a CRB check). You can only check someone’s criminal record if they’re applying for certain roles.

This tool only covers roles in England and Wales. Find out if you can get a check in Scotland or Northern Ireland.

If you’re applying for the role

You can’t get a check for yourself, but you can use this tool to see if your criminal record can be checked.

If your employer can’t check your record they may ask you to request a ‘basic disclosure’ instead.

Checking for a management role

Use this tool to see if you can check the staff they manage. If you can, you can request that same check for the manager.

nodes.title: What type of role is it?

options.label: Healthcare or working in a hospital
Caring for or working with children (under 18) or working in a school
Working with elderly, ill or disabled adults

nodes.title: What does the role with children involve?

options.label: Working in a school but not in a teaching role, for example as a cleaner
Moderating an online chatroom or online media

nodes.title: What does the teaching or caring involve?

options.label: Childminding (includes people living on childminding premises)
Working in a school, nursery, children's centre or home, detention service, youth offenders institution or childcare premises
Teaching, training or supervising children, but not in a school, nursery, children's centre or home, detention service, youth offenders institution or childcare premises
Helping ill or disabled children with eating or drinking, or helping ill, disabled or young children with washing, dressing or going to the toilet
Giving advice about physical, emotional or educational wellbeing, for example as a therapist
Fostering or adopting a child or working with fostered or adopted children

nodes.title: Will the work be done frequently?

body.content:
Answer 'yes' if the role involves any of the following:

+ working more than 3 times a month with children
+ working overnight (between 2am and 6am) where there may be face-to-face contact with children and the work involves teaching, training, supervising, advising, guiding or caring for children

Answer ‘yes’ if the role involves any of the following:

  • working more than 3 times a month with children
  • working overnight (between 2am and 6am) where there may be face-to-face contact with children and the work involves teaching, training, supervising, advising, guiding or caring for children
